column5: Congrat's to you and Kristi Steve. The new look is amazing by the way! You are sure giving Brian a run for his money.
Congrats on the addition bud.I would be hard pressed to recognize you now from what you were.Good job. Joe
I guess it's funny how fast life moves!

Hey All...  Welcome Callum to my family.  Cooper and Carson are very excited for their new brother to be running around with them.  For the meantime we are planning some R & R.  Callum Edward was 5lbs 14oz born on Friday April 24.  Kristi had a C-Section and is now in full recovery.  Day one was tough, Day two was much better.  Today some of her new friends will be popping by to visit with us.  The joke is that since Callum is American we should get him on the ballot for Presidential Elections.  We could have a Prime Minister and a President.   I have attached a couple of photo's but don't have them on an internet site...Let's see if anyone can figure out how to imbed them?  The first is my two big boys Coop and Carson (Bobo) and I playing in the yard.  The second is wee Cal joining us.  I will put another post on this thread with a couple more.
Daddy & the Baby  Mommy and the Baby  And Mommy and the Coop hanging out in the afternoon yesterday...

Congratulations to you Steve. You and your wife must be so happy and proud now. Ummm I think you'll be needing another John Deere very soon. Great stuff, thanks so much for posting Bud.  Edit: Man! I can't believe how much weight you've lost!
congrats. all the best to your wife and now. not so small family !  TB
Congratulations, and all the best to your family.
Congrats.  A whole team of fishermen.  Should be busy for the next 5 years.
As a father of three myself I gotta say "CONGRATULATIONS" and if you don't stop at three we'll soon be calling you Marty....LOL
Good lookin' lad, big congratulations!
Congrats! Looks like you'll be busy for a while
Congratulations...only 8 more to go for a soccer team

Steve, congrats brother!!! that is awesome to see you and K adding to the US tax burden LOL... that Callum is already 70,000.00 in debt! LOL just joking brother!  As Roy mentioned.... you have slimmed down dude... no way can you be referred to as stout fellow#1 any longer..  Congrats man!!!  G
Great news, Steve.  Congratulations to you and Kristi, a fine lookin fambly you have there.  And I will add my compliments too, you are a shadow of your former self, no longer a "stout fellow".
congrats! cigars???
Congrats to the new addition to the family Steve, and also on the weight loss.
Wow, congrats Steve, what a beautiful baby.  You sure did lose alot of weight, looking good bud  Joey
Congrats on the new addition!
Awesome Steve.Nice addition to the family.Congrats.  Your looking mighty trim there too bud.
Congratulations on the new addition to the family He's a cutie and a keeper Glad that mommy is doing better  Congratulations once again Leechman
no chicken wings in PA? or are you biking to your sales calls now? nice look'n fam there Steve.... time surely flies, as I 'member 5 yrs ago when you were eagerly awaiting Coop's arrivial
Did ya want our addresses for cigars Steve??  Congrats to you and the Mrs.. and them two other fine young lads of yours, on the new arrival.

Really cool Steve! Congratulations on the new arrival... and a genuine American citizen to boot! The chicken wing trade must really be suffering down there since you went all healthy on them? Keep up the good work in that department as well.
Congratulations to you and your family! Jim

Thanks Ladies and Gents!  Kristi and the new man come home tomorow.  Coop, Carson and I are planning two weeks of gardening, we have some norwegian spruce being planted on Thursday, a truck full of dirt on wednesday and a few tons of blonde p-stone coming on Friday.  I have a small wheelbarrow for each of the boys and a big one for me.  In a wise move, I also have a couple cases of beer for my neighbour!   I trust that with the boys and I busy outside this week Kristi shall be able to rest with the smallest one in here.  On the weight loss...It's been a lot of work and a lot of fun!  Still eating my share of wings, just making sure to output a lot of calories every day.
That's awesome man! Congrats! I forgot how small they were when they're born! Haha best wishes for your wife and the little man!  Cheers, Ryan
